intro: Loxotrema vestita, commonly known as the white-stalked earthstar, is a unique member of the Lecanoraceae family. It is a foliose lichen that forms a distinctive, star-like structure when mature, with a central stalk and radiating lobes. The thallus is typically pale to yellowish in color, with a smooth, leathery texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on decaying wood or soil in temperate regions. Its chemical composition includes various secondary metabolites that contribute to its ecological role in nutrient cycling and habitat diversity.
